adjectives.description: walkable (comparative more walkable, superlative most walkable)

entries.meaning: Able to be walked; suitable for pedestrians.
examples: This route is no longer walkable since the bush and the vines grew over it.
Cities were generally much more walkable before the mid-20th century.

entries.meaning: Short enough or close enough to be accessible by walking.
examples: Is the train station walkable from here?
